content.description: Low crux to start and high crux at the top pulling the bulge. Fun hands and stemming the whole way. Face holds too.
content.protection: Hand sized pieces and few smaller ones too. You can clip the first bolt of shotgun for a muzzle and a bolt higher up that belongs to lost in limbo.
content.location: Same start as Shotgun for a muzzle, then traverses into the chimney to the right. Follow the crack.

content.description: Good edge climbing up the left side of the east face
content.location: scramble up to the base of the east face

content.description: Quality face climbing up the middle of the face
content.protection: 5 Bolts, 3 link chain anchor shares with Easily Tempted.
content.location: Middle route on the east face

content.description: Start on the right side of the wall in a short hand crack. Akward climbing leads to thin face and then a small roof. The best route on the wall!
content.location: start on the right side of the N. face in a short hand crack

content.description: An Awkward chimney leads to a less awkward offwidth. Gain a stance on top of a dubiously connected flake. Stem across to the opposite wall and transfer to a deep vertical crack. Slammer hands and fists for the final 15 feet.
content.protection: Mostly mental pro for the first 30 feet. I wouldn't trust any of it until the final hand crack, hence the R rating. The landing is bad but the climbing is secure. A tipped out #6 "protects" the chimney, small cams and TCUs can be placed under sketchy flakes on the left. A #5 fits at the back of the offwidth between the tall wall and the partially detached white flake. Once you gain the stance and transfer to the hand crack, plug as many hand sized cams as you like with confidence. Two-bolt anchor can be reached from the back through a series of fun chimney scrambles and one easy 5th class move.
content.location: Hidden deep in a corridor guarded by large boulders on the west side of The Tomb. Skirt the formation to the right (west) and find an opening between two pillars near the southwest corner. Enter here, tunnel left, then turn right to find the chimney.

content.description: The first half of the climb is tough, but once you reach some great holds it's smooth sailing.
content.location: The Tomb in Apple Valley Crags.

content.description: Slab route on a detached pillar on the right side of the formation. Tricky moves to start, crux is thin slab approaching the upper bulge.
content.location: Detached pinnacle on the right side of the Tomb

content.description: There are multiple ways to climb the lower section. Get creative. Two bolts lead to left slanting finger crack that is a little trickier than it looks from below.
content.protection: Two bolts, thin finger sized gear, rap ring.
content.location: To the left of Room To Tomb in the Entombed corridor

content.description: Akward climbing past two bolts leads over a block to jugs on the main face
content.location: Start in a chimney and detached block on the right. A good way to get a TR on the 11’s

content.description: This is a dead vertical splitter finger tips crack for most of it's length. The crux is the first couple moves after leaving the ground, and it doesn't let up after that. Bad feet and technical movement demand a precise sequence and calm momentum. The only two good finger locks are the starting holds. After that, it's pure tips and tricks until you reach a sloped stance below two featured bulges. From here it's fun 5.9 until the crack traverses left. A couple tenuous moves left in a thin crack brings you to the last couple meters up the deep hand crack on neighboring Room To Tomb.
content.protection: All the smallest cams and nuts you have. Careful down low. Mussy hooks shared with Room To Tomb.
content.location: Hidden deep in a corridor guarded by large boulders on the west side of The Tomb. Skirt the formation to the right (west) and find an opening between two pillars near the southwest corner. Enter here, tunnel left, then turn right to find the Room to Tomb chimney. Entombed is on the right hand north-facing wall.

content.description: Right route, joins Sky Flying By at the last bolt
content.protection: 5 Bolts, 3 link chain anchor shares w/Sky Flying By.
content.location: Right side of the east face

content.description: Start as for Dead Flake but break out right at the second bolt
content.location: Start on Dead Flake and clip the first two bolts on that route

content.description: A long reach or a boost reaches the first jug. Follow the flake in the middle more or less.
content.location: The obvious flake in the middle of the face with the first hold ten feet off the ground
the leftmost route on the N. face
